data.title: 1927 The Works of John Galsworthy
data.meta_description: 1927 The Works of John Galsworthy Comprising a miscellaneous of John Galsworthy's works, including novels, plays, and poems. Included in this collection, the author's most popular work The Forsyte Saga and its sequel A Modern Comedy. John Galsworthy was a
data.text:
Description

Pleasing Copy, Publishers' Original Binding

Comprising four volumes of from the Grove edition of the collected works of John Galsworthy, including novels, plays, and poems. Galsworthy most popular works include The Forsyte Saga and its sequel A Modern Comedy. John Galsworthy was an English novelist and playwright. He was the winner of the Nobel Prize in Literature in 1932.

The present set is comprised of the following:

'Saint's Progress'; 'Fraternity;' 'Villa Rubein;' and 'Beyond.'

Condition

In the original publisher's uniform full cloth binding with gilt tooling to spine. Externally with minor shelf wear, lightly bumped to head and tail of spine and extremities. Boards lightly marked. Minor puncture mark to front free blank leaf 'Beyond' and title page 'Fraternity.' Internally, firmly bound. Pages bright and clean.

Overall: Very Good Indeed

Delivery & payment

We send all of our books via courier which is a fully tracked and insured service. In our experience we find this to be the most reliable and quickest form of delivery. Our primary courier is DHL, but we are able to accommodate special requests if required, including postal delivery for items under 2kg. See More Details
